headline: Forestar Group (FOR) Is Up 12.5% After Beating Revenue And EBITDA Forecasts But Missing Profit Targets – Has The Bull Case Changed?
summary: In the past quarter, Forestar Group, the D.R. Horton–controlled land developer, reported a 9% year-on-year revenue increase and exceeded analysts’ revenue and EBITDA estimates, while missing adjusted operating income expectations. The company also outlined plans for fiscal 2026 to deliver between 14,000 and 15,000 residential lots, targeting US$1.60 billion to US$1.70 billion in revenue as it manages inventory investment against affordability pressures and cautious consumer sentiment. We’ll...
